elPollo.title: El Pollo Loco
elPollo.description: A classical Jump’n’Run game using JavaScript, OOP and Canvas. Help Pepe to find coins and salsa bottles to fight off the evil chickens.
elPollo.solo: Through building El Pollo Loco, I deepened my understanding of object-oriented programming and game logic using JavaScript and HTML5 Canvas. It taught me how to structure a game engine, handle animations, collisions, and create a playable 2D game from scratch.

join.title: Join
join.description: Task manager inspired by the Kanban system. Create and organize tasks using drag and drop functions, assign users and categories.
join.group: We were a group of 3. My role was the login and signup pages as well as reusable components. We had a great work flow, good communication and team spirit was always up.

pokedex.title: Pokedex
pokedex.description: A simple library that provides and catalogues Pokémon information, based on the PokeAPI.
pokedex.solo: This project taught me how to work with external APIs by integrating the PokeAPI to fetch and display dynamic data. It helped me improve my skills in asynchronous JavaScript, data filtering, and building interactive UI components.

why.title: Why me
why.reason: I’m passionate about coding because it combines analytical thinking with creativity. I enjoy solving problems, finding clean solutions, and turning ideas into working features. I’m persistent when things get tricky and love collaborating with others to learn, improve, and build better products together.
